definition: to submerge/to immerse/to sink/to keep down/to lower/to drop/deep/profound/heavy
lit. the mountains crumble and the trees lie ruined/a great sage has died (idiom)
lit. clouds scatter, wind flows (idiom); the crisis settles down/people disperse home/things return to normal
to pledge undying love (idiom); oath of eternal love/to swear by all the Gods
cold pillow and lonely bed (idiom); fig. cold and solitary existence
lit. a chicken and a bottle of wine (idiom); fig. ready to make an offering to the deceased, or to entertain guests
to part for an unspecified period/to take leave from indefinitely
lit. the old man lost his horse, but it all turned out for the best (idiom)/fig. a blessing in disguise/it's an ill wind that blows nobody any good
to scoop up water with the hands
to stir up trouble (idiom)/to sow discord
lit. almanac from years back (idiom)/obsolete practice/old-fashioned principle
